Header: Giant panda conservation center claims largest captive panda group in world
Content: The number of captive-bred giant pandas at a conservation and research center in southwest China’s Sichuan Province has reached 312 the world’s largest giant panda group in captivity. The youngest panda cubs in the center, the China Conservation and Research Center for the Giant Panda, are twins born on Aug 31 by a giant panda called Su Lin. Reproduction of captive pandas used to be a challenge, but efforts of the center over the years have paid off: the number of pandas in captivity at the center increases from 10 at the beginning to the current 312.
